channel.title: Unturned 2
channel.description:
[i]Unturned is a Free to play, Multiplayer Zombie Survival game. The game is fairly new and was released on Steam on July 7, 2014. The game is constantly being updated with new features, and it never gets boring. [/i]
[i]Personal Rating: 5/5[/i]
Note: This game is only available on [url=http://store.steampowered.com/]Steam[/url]
[b]Gameplay:[/b] It is a bit difficult starting out, and is very slow. You will die a lot trying to get started up which can be extremely frustrating. After getting used to the gameplay style it made it a lot easier (Mostly combat wise). Within 10 hours of scavenging I built a camp and learned to craft. After expanding it becomes a lot more fun. The game is a lot like Day-Z with graphics quite similar to Roblox. I recommend this game to anybody who enjoys hardcore survival games.
[url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/304930/]For more information click here![/url]
[b]Features:[/b] The game has many added features to both benefit you in-game and enhance your game-play experience.
[ul][li]Unturned Gold: Is a paid feature that allows buffs in-game to better you off in-game.[/li] [li]Skills: Unturned has a point system that allows you to level up skills using experience points to help you perform tasks easier.[/li] [li]Multiplayer: The game is a multiplayer online game, where you can choose to survive with others or survive independently. PvP can be toggled on or off by the host[/li] [li]Crafting: Crafting can be used to expand and build shelter, fortresses etc.[/li] [li]Heroes: Players can join player versus environment servers to team up with other people, and easily create clans to play with their pals. [/li] [li]Character: Character customization to change your appearance[/li][/ul]
[url=http://steamcommunity.com/app/304930/discussions/6/]Multiplayer Server list #1[/url] [url=http://unturned-servers.net/]Multiplayer Server list #2[/url]
[url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=294363184]Crafting Guide[/url]
[i]OS Requirements[/i] [spoiler][IMG]http://i.imgur.com/Hdicoey.png[/img][/spoiler]
[b]Exploring:[/b] Unturned's map is an okay size, i'd like it if it was a little bit bigger. After about 30 hours of gameplay I had familiarized myself with the map and know my way around quite easily. It was a lot of fun exploring though as a beginner! [spoiler][IMG]http://img2.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20140711144649/unturned-bunker/images/e/e9/Unturnedmap.png[/img][/spoiler]
[b]Graphics:[/b] I enjoy the graphics a lot. They are much like Roblox. It can be hard to see during the night so anything that emits light is highly useful. There is blood, but that can easily be toggled on or off in the game settings. [spoiler][IMG]http://i.imgur.com/lSa6v9I.jpg[/img][/spoiler]
[b]Trailer[/b] [youtube]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rIXzyNuGwfM[/youtube]

item.title: Unturned 2
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

Was just looking for a F2P game to play on steam, the one I was playing is offline for maintenance, bastards.

Thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: Unturned 2
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Wanted to add something. This game will run under linux on a low-end system. I currenty only have a simple Acer C720 chromebook with lubuntu 14.04 with a few fixes for better hardware support. I can run Unturned 2 on lowest settings, with 150% draw distance and still get a nice framerate. Just install the newest wine, install Steam (may need to disable dwrite.dll, I have to). Runs great under Wine.

CPU: Intel 1.4GHz dual-core Haswell
RAM: 2GB
SSD: 16GB
OS: lubuntu 14.04 with 3.17RC3 kernel.

Read full topic

item.title: Unturned 2
item.dc:creator: @Basix Basix
item.description:
@Basix wrote:

[quote=“iCreatedHorror, post:5, topic:545849”][quote author=xEthanx link=topic=664732.msg4443982#msg4443982 date=1407890903]
I actually think it looks like it could be a blast, especially if I’m playing with friends. I’ll check it out.

Btw, nice review.
[/quote]it’s only fun with friends on populated, dedicated servers. sadly, hackers ruined this about as quick as it went on steam.[/quote]

Agree’d, but if you have a few friends playing LAN or even hosting a private server it’s even more enjoyable.

Read full topic

item.title: Unturned 2
item.dc:creator: @Basix Basix
item.description:
@Basix wrote:

Unturned is a Free to play, Multiplayer Zombie Survival game. The game is fairly new and was released on Steam on July 7, 2014. The game is constantly being updated with new features, and it never gets boring.

Personal Rating: 5/5

Note: This game is only available on Steam

Gameplay: It is a bit difficult starting out, and is very slow. You will die a lot trying to get started up which can be extremely frustrating. After getting used to the gameplay style it made it a lot easier (Mostly combat wise). Within 10 hours of scavenging I built a camp and learned to craft. After expanding it becomes a lot more fun. The game is a lot like Day-Z with graphics quite similar to Roblox. I recommend this game to anybody who enjoys hardcore survival games.

For more information click here!

Features: The game has many added features to both benefit you in-game and enhance your game-play experience.

[ul][li]Unturned Gold: Is a paid feature that allows buffs in-game to better you off in-game.[/li]
[li]Skills: Unturned has a point system that allows you to level up skills using experience points to help you perform tasks easier.[/li]
[li]Multiplayer: The game is a multiplayer online game, where you can choose to survive with others or survive independently. PvP can be toggled on or off by the host[/li]
[li]Crafting: Crafting can be used to expand and build shelter, fortresses etc.[/li]
[li]Heroes: Players can join player versus environment servers to team up with other people, and easily create clans to play with their pals. [/li]
[li]Character: Character customization to change your appearance[/li][/ul]

Multiplayer Server list #1
Multiplayer Server list #2

Crafting Guide

OS Requirements
[spoiler][/spoiler]

Exploring: Unturned’s map is an okay size, i’d like it if it was a little bit bigger. After about 30 hours of gameplay I had familiarized myself with the map and know my way around quite easily. It was a lot of fun exploring though as a beginner!
[spoiler][/spoiler]

Graphics: I enjoy the graphics a lot. They are much like Roblox. It can be hard to see during the night so anything that emits light is highly useful. There is blood, but that can easily be toggled on or off in the game settings.
[spoiler][/spoiler]

Trailer
[youtube]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rIXzyNuGwfM[/youtube]

Read full topic
